acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 48 hours EC50=97microg/L of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data, 2005).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (dermal route) value of 560mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1972)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Classification cannot be determined, though the available rat inhalation study reported the LC50 value of >1.5mg/L (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1988)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is a liquid according to the GHS criteria and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 580mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1969)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: There was no treatment-related increase in tumor incidence observed in mouse carcinogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1986, 1988)).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since there was rapidly degrading (the decomposition by TOC: 73%(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)) and the bio-accumulation was low (log Kow=2.71(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), it was claasified into Not classified.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on negative data in mouse in vivo micronucleus tests and rat in vivo unscheduled DNA synthesis tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1989)). When tested in vitro, the substance tested positive for chromosome aberration (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1989)) and negative for reverse mutation (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1976)).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Cannot be classified though being organic compounds containing oxygen bound to elements other than carbon and hydrogen

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Considered non-pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures since the substance is stable to heat (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data)

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on the evidence of increased incidence of the runting syndrome and decreased viability at doses causing a reduction in parental body weight gain observed in rat 2-generation reproduction studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1988)).

self_heating_substances.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on no evidence of irritation observed in rabbit eye irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1986)).

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on no evidence of irritation observed in rabbit skin irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1986)).

skin_sensitizer.rationale: No skin sensitizing potential was found in guinea pig sensitization tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1986)).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Stable to water (water solubility: 115.9mg/L (20degC) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data))

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (nervous system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "fibrous contraction," "tremors," and "piloerection" (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1969, 1970)). These effects were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "convulsions," "tremors," "ataxic gait," and "salivation" (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1969)). These effects were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1.
